content.raw: Looking more deeply into the `virtual_stix.ign` I see there is some new code in there for generating the SDF for each robot \(e.g., spawnX1\) is this the new standard way to add robots to a world @{557058:095b1e12-74ed-4e20-b44f-2f0745b616e0} ? If so, should it somehow be pulled out into a more generic `ign` file \(perhaps the `team.ign`\)?
content.html: Looking more deeply into the virtual_stix.ign I see there is some new code in there for generating the SDF for each robot (e.g., spawnX1) is this the new standard way to add robots to a world @Nate Koenig ? If so, should it somehow be pulled out into a more generic ign file (perhaps the team.ign)?

content.raw: Working on it, or getting help from @{5cf75629ff02b50ea27b2817} .
content.html: Working on it, or getting help from @Alfredo Bencomo .

content.raw: When I looked at this before, making this dynamic will tie into the fix for #78
content.html: When I looked at this before, making this dynamic will tie into the fix for #78

content.raw:
So, I think the core problem is that the robots should specified in the `ign launch competition.ign` command. For example:

```
ign launch competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1
```

Then the `team.ign` file goes away. It looks like @{5cf75629ff02b50ea27b2817} updated the wiki page. I'll look into removing the team.ign file and updating the competition.ign file.
content.html:
So, I think the core problem is that the robots should specified in the ign launch competition.ign command. For example:

ign launch competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

Then the team.ign file goes away. It looks like @Alfredo Bencomo updated the wiki page. I'll look into removing the team.ign file and updating the competition.ign file.

content.raw:
From Issue #74 we were only able to spawn using vitual\_stix.ign and not competition.ign, as below  

ign launch -v 4 virtual\_stix.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_1 robotName3:=X3 robotConfig3:=X3\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_1 robotName4:=X4 robotConfig4:=X4\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_1

‌

otherwise we get the same blank window as @{557058:42fc2023-4935-4b2e-8079-075649866124}
content.html:
From Issue #74 we were only able to spawn using vitual_stix.ign and not competition.ign, as below

ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName3:=X3 robotConfig3:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName4:=X4 robotConfig4:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

‌

otherwise we get the same blank window as @baila

content.raw: Can you confirm that you have the latest software versions running on your system. See: #!/osrf/subt/wiki/system_requirements

content.raw:
I’m running into similar issues with the example setup tutorial [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/ExampleSetup](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/ExampleSetup)

I checked all software versions and switched to the tunnel\_circuit branch \(will that be made the new default for cloning? Is [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/system\_requirements](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/system_requirements) the only place that mentions that branch?\)

It initially was unable to locate ros1-ign-bridge and attempted to solve with @{557058:1f28259c-05de-48ba-8999-15883e0df24e} 's instructions in #89.

```
cd ~/subt_ws/src
git clone https://github.com/osrf/ros1_ign.git
cd ~/subt_ws
catkin_make install
```

After running `roslaunch subt_example teleop.launch` and `ign launch -v 4 tunnel_circuit_practice.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_03 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1` in separate terminals, I can see the tunnel circuit and the X1 robot in gazebo.

Both `rostopic echo /X1/cmd_vel` and `ign topic -e -t /model/X1/cmd_vel_relay` show nonzero values, but the robot doesn’t move. Additionally, the lights don’t turn on/off. And the /X1/front/image\_raw isn’t being published

content.raw:
Derek,

After you clone [tunnel\_circuit](#!/osrf/subt/branch/tunnel_circuit) branch, you need to switch that branch \(see below\). I just updated the tutorial page with that info. Sorry about that.

`hg clone #!/osrf/subt/branch/tunnel_circuit`  
`cd ~/subt_ws/src/tunnel_circuit`  
`hg update -c tunnel_circuit`

Then, run `catkin_make install` again.
content.html:
Derek,

After you clone tunnel_circuit branch, you need to switch that branch (see below). I just updated the tutorial page with that info. Sorry about that.

hg clone #!/osrf/subt/branch/tunnel_circuit
cd ~/subt_ws/src/tunnel_circuit
hg update -c tunnel_circuit

Then, run catkin_make install again.

The camera image is publishing, and I get nonzero values when I run `rostopic echo /X1/cmd_vel`, but `ign topic -e -t /model/X1/cmd_vel_relay` doesn’t show anything being published and the robot still doesn’t move.

That did fix the \[…/parameter\_bridge\] error.

Following the instructions on [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/ExampleSetup](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/ExampleSetup), however, I am still unable to use the joystick to control either X1 or X4, the camera image is not being published, and the RTF is <4%.

content.raw:
You can ignore those two error messages for now. The RTF at less that 4% is problem that we are looking into it; which also causes the camera image not being displayed. We’re hoping to get these issues resolved in the next couple of days. In the meantime, I suggest you use the competition.ign world.

`ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`
content.html:
You can ignore those two error messages for now. The RTF at less that 4% is problem that we are looking into it; which also causes the camera image not being displayed. We’re hoping to get these issues resolved in the next couple of days. In the meantime, I suggest you use the competition.ign world.

ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

content.raw:
Derek,

I failed to mention about the joystick. Run these commands and build it again.

cd ~/subt\_ws/src/tunnel\_circuit  
hg pull && hg up  
cd ~/subt\_ws/  
catkin\_make install

I just tested it with [F310](https://www.target.com/p/logitech-f310-gamepad/-/A-13670128) and it works.  Make sure the Mode LED is OFF and DirectInput \(D\) mode is selected.
content.html:
Derek,

I failed to mention about the joystick. Run these commands and build it again.

cd ~/subt_ws/src/tunnel_circuit
hg pull && hg up
cd ~/subt_ws/
catkin_make install

I just tested it with F310 and it works. Make sure the Mode LED is OFF and DirectInput (D) mode is selected.

content.raw:
I followed the instructions to install using catkin and got to the same point as @{5cf560a5c90d790e902d5ed6} . I am able to move X1 and X2 \(They move super slow due to the RTF\), but not X3-X4. Also the competition.ign loads half of the tunnel \(I wonder if it is because it takes a lot of time download/load that we don't see the rest\). I tried the virtual\_stix.ign and that one loads all but still the robots move very slow. btw, I’m not able to turn the lights off/on.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2321237754-competition.png)
content.html: I followed the instructions to install using catkin and got to the same point as @Derek Knowles . I am able to move X1 and X2 (They move super slow due to the RTF), but not X3-X4. Also the competition.ign loads half of the tunnel (I wonder if it is because it takes a lot of time download/load that we don't see the rest). I tried the virtual_stix.ign and that one loads all but still the robots move very slow. btw, I’m not able to turn the lights off/on.

content.raw: The team is looking into the RTF performance issue right now, so we should have a fix soon. Regarding `competition.ign`, that is actually the whole tunnel \(not just half\). It's just short compare to the `virtual_stix.ign`. However, the goal is for competitors to use the `tunnel_circuit_practice.ign` instead of the two former.
content.html: The team is looking into the RTF performance issue right now, so we should have a fix soon. Regarding competition.ign, that is actually the whole tunnel (not just half). It's just short compare to the virtual_stix.ign. However, the goal is for competitors to use the tunnel_circuit_practice.ign instead of the two former.

content.raw:
I can confirm that for me the instructions on  [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/ExampleSetup](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/ExampleSetup) don’t allow me to move any of the robots, but replacing `ign launch -v 4 tunnel_circuit_practice.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_03 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1` with the suggested `ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1` I can move around the X1 with the F310 controller and view images successfully. 

Hector, my competition.ign loaded dynamically as the robot explored the tunnel system.

Like Hector, I also had problems moving the X3 & X4 vehicles. 

`ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1` and  `ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X2 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1` allowed me to move around the X1 & X2 vehicles, but `ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X3 robotConfig1:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1` and  `ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X4 robotConfig1:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_1` spawned the X3 & X4 robots, but I couldn't move them with my controller. It looks like the `/X4/cmd_vel/` topic is being published with nonzero values, but the props on the X3 & X4 vehicles don’t move at all.
content.html:
I can confirm that for me the instructions on #!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/ExampleSetup don’t allow me to move any of the robots, but replacing ign launch -v 4 tunnel_circuit_practice.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_03 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 with the suggested ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 I can move around the X1 with the F310 controller and view images successfully.

Hector, my competition.ign loaded dynamically as the robot explored the tunnel system.

Like Hector, I also had problems moving the X3 & X4 vehicles.

ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 and ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X2 robotConfig1:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 allowed me to move around the X1 & X2 vehicles, but ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X3 robotConfig1:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 and ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X4 robotConfig1:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 spawned the X3 & X4 robots, but I couldn't move them with my controller. It looks like the /X4/cmd_vel/ topic is being published with nonzero values, but the props on the X3 & X4 vehicles don’t move at all.

content.raw: Regarding moving the X3 & X4 vehicles, see [pull request #190](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/190/logitech_configyaml-copy-vertical-scale/diff); which was merged into the `tunnel_circuit` release branch today.
content.html: Regarding moving the X3 & X4 vehicles, see pull request #190; which was merged into the tunnel_circuit release branch today.

content.raw: The ExampleSetup tutorial has been update.  Regarding the issue with X3 and X4, see [#97](#!/osrf/subt/issues/97/potential-issue-with-x3-x4-control-via).
content.html: The ExampleSetup tutorial has been update. Regarding the issue with X3 and X4, see #97.
